moves.1. h4: Now, those who have a slightest idea about chess have probably already assumed that this game is going to be intolerable!
moves.1... a5: It seems as though as if black has chosen one of the worst ever tactics; copycat. Especially when white has not played a great move.
moves.2. b4: eh? it seems white wants to threaten black but forgot to defend the pawn!
moves.2... a4: Now black has felt threatened and basically avoided it!
moves.3. c4: This game is now suspiciosly looking like a game to do with just pawns
moves.3... b6: I have no clue what so ever why someone would do that move unless they wanted to play the modern opening  but I doubt it would be very effective now!!
moves.4. Qxa4: Oh! Now I get it. White must have played c4 to earn that pawn. However, it is difficult to comprehend how a pawn for a queen would be of any benifit.
moves.4... b5: I guess black missed its chance and basically blundered its rook.
moves.5. Qa5: Maybe not; white still seems willing to give up its queen.
moves.5... Ba6: How clever of black; it stopped white's queen taking its rook and protected its pawn but maybe RXa5 would have been simpler.
moves.6... c5: Black seems to be hoping that white does not note that surprise attack on the queen, though in most people's opinion black should have taken the queen for free when it had its chance.
moves.7. Qb6: White really does seem determine to give up its queen
moves.7... d5: Maybe black wants to gain control of the center finally!
moves.8. exd5: But white has mastered the art of taking!
moves.8... e6: Black cannot bear such a shame and retorts with another lousy attack.
moves.9. dxe6: White's pawn trundles on, bashing through black's defences!
moves.9... Nf6: Ah! Black has decided that now is a pleasant time to get more control of the center! (bad timing)!
moves.10. exf7+: How amazing! white'spawn has now reached to the king unharmed. Maybe a queen is likely
moves.10... Kd7: Black was limited to a few squares but surely it should've taken the pawn!
moves.11. Qc7+: White really does seem slightly dense now!
moves.12... Bd6: One of the only good attempts in this match to protect the queen!
moves.13. f8=N+: For some bizzare reason white has fancied a knight as a reward for reaching the end. Maybe it knows that it will be taken, so a check may as well do!
moves.13... Kf5: However, the king is on his own journey!
moves.14... g5: Back to its pawn adavancing skills
moves.15. dxc5: White is now on a role.
moves.16... Bb2: Maybe black wanted to attack the rook and the bishop at the same time
moves.17. bxa6: White obviously prefers the other bishop.
moves.17... Rxa6: Black takes its first ever piece!
moves.18. Qxb8: Another miracle; white did a good move!
moves.19. Qe5+: White must have thought that black is two years old!
moves.20. f3+: White seems to have got the hang of checking now!
moves.20... Kh5: The inevitable checkmate is bound to come!
moves.21. hxg5#: MOST PEOPLE WOULD HAVE EXPECTED Qxg5 BUT EITHER WHITE WAS BEING FANCY OR JUST DIDN'T REALISE AND WANTED TO GET ANOTHER POINT UP. this was an utter thrash but a very sloppy one!

gameName: One of the SLOPPIEST games ever
